FuncDef: The display chassis-id command displays the ID of a specified chassis and its next startup chassis ID or all chassis IDs and next startup chassis IDs.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the IDs of all chassis.
-

Displays the ID of a specified chassis, which is represented in the form of chassis type+chassis ID.
The chassis ID is 1 or 2. A chassis example is CLC1 or CLC2.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When deploying a virtual cluster system, you can run the display chassis-id command to check whether the ID of each chassis meets requirements.
Configuration Impact
If chassis-id is not specified, the ID of the current chassis and its next startup chassis ID are displayed. If all is specified, all chassis IDs and next startup chassis IDs are displayed.
Follow-up Procedure
If the value of next-run-chassis-id displayed in the command output is not as expected, you must run the set chassis-id command to change the chassis ID.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
